title: Joey Barton set for lengthy ban as he prepares to face FA commission over betting charge
text:
Joey Barton set for lengthy ban as he prepares to face FA commission over betting charge The Burnley midfielder's Premier league career could be in tatters next month Share Barton will learn his fate early next month (Photo: Clive Brunskill) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Joey Barton is facing a lengthy ban which could wreck his Premier League career when he appears before an FA commission early next month. 
Burnley who offered the 34-year-old bad boy of football a contract until the end of the season fear that the midfielder will be frozen out of the game after admitting that he placed 1,260 football related bets between 26 March 2006 and 13 May 2016. 
Barton requested a personal hearing and had managed to delay his day of reckoning, but a date has now been set for the second week in March. 
It means Saturday’s trip to Swansea could be his last game for the Clarets. Down and out? Barton's Clarets career is in doubt (Photo: Getty) 
Burnley believe that the FA will come down hard on a player who has courted controversy throughout his career. 
Crystal Palace and England winger Andros Townsend was handed a four match ban, three of which were suspended, after being found guilty of flouting betting regulations while at Spurs, but in November Frome Town manager Nick Bunyard was suspended for three years on betting charges. 
A substantial ban would almost certainly mean Burnley having to forget any thoughts of offering Barton a new deal placing his future in serious doubt.
